text: see those bees with numbers on their
backs shaking their tails
that's a waggle dance that bees used to
communicate to the rest of the hive
they're saying free venti lattes over at
the blue feeder really researchers at
the University of Sussex wanted to find
out how caffeine affects bee behavior
they trained two groups of bees to go to
two different feeders both filled with
the same nectar then they added caffeine
to the blue one just the amount that
many flowers actually have the PISA
drank the caffeinated nectar visited the
feeder more often than the other group
and they waggle danced more often but
there was no difference in nectar
quality so that caffeine tricked the
bees into overestimating the nutritional
value of the nectar that's great for
flowers that have caffeinated nectar
more bee visits more pollination but it
could mean that bees miss out on some
high-quality decaf once they get a buzz
on search no more
